intro: Schefflera benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet schefflera, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated as a houseplant in some regions.
